Home → New Chapters: Mental health information services → Reading Well for young people

Reading Well for young people

Reading Well have compiled a list of 35 recommended books on the topic of young people’s mental health. You can borrow these books from our libraries or from our eLibrary service.

General

  • Stuff That Sucks: Accepting What You Can’t Change and Committing to What You Can by Ben Sedley

  • Mind Your Head by Juno Dawson

  • The Self-Esteem Team’s Guide to Sex, Drugs and WTFs?!! by The Self-Esteem Team

  • Blame My Brain: The Amazing Teenage Brain Revealed by Nicola Morgan

  • Quiet the Mind</a> by Matthew Johnstone

  • I’ll Give You the Sun</a> by Jandy Nelson

  • Kite Spirit by Sita Brahmachari

  • House of Windows by Alexia Casale

  • Every Day by David Levithan

ADHD

  • Putting on the Brakes: Understanding and Taking Control of Your ADD or ADHD by Patricia Quinn and Judith Stern

Anxiety, worry and panic

  • My Anxious Mind: A Teen’s Guide to Managing Anxiety and Panic by Michael Tompkins and Katherine Martinez

  • The Anxiety Survival Guide for Teens: CBT Skills to Overcome Fear, Worry and Panic by Jennifer Shannon (eBook)

  • The Shyness and Social Anxiety Workbook for Teens by Jennifer Shannon (eBook)

  • The Perks of Being a Wallflower by Stephen Chbosky

Autism and Asperger syndrome

  • The Reason I Jump by Naoki Higashida

  • Freaks, Geeks and Asperger Syndrome: A User’s Guide to Adolescence by Luke Jackson

  • The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time by Mark Haddon

Body image and eating disorders

  • Can I Tell You About Eating Disorders? by Bryan Lask and Lucy Watson

  • Banish Your Body Image Thief: a cognitive behavioural therapy workbook on building positive body image for young people by Kate Collins-Donnelly

  • Tyranny</a> by Lesley Fairfield

Bullying

  • Teen Life Confidential: Bullies, Cyberbullies and Frenemies by Michele Elliott

  • Vicious: True Stories by Teens about Bullying edited by Hope Vanderberg (eBook)

Confidence and self-esteem

  • Banish Your Self-Esteem Thief: A Cognitive Behavioural Therapy Workbook on Building Positive Self-Esteem for Young People by Kate Collins-Donnelly

  • Teen Life Confidential: Self-Esteem and Being You by Anita Naik

  • Face by Benjamin Zephaniah

Depression

  • Am I Depressed and What Can I Do About it? by Shirley Reynolds and Monika Parkinson

  • I Had a Black Dog by Matthew Johnstone

  • Can I Tell You About Depression? by Christopher Dowrick and Susan Martin

Mood swings

  • Don’t Let Your Emotions Run Your Life for Teens by Sheri van Dijk

OCD

  • Touch and Go Joe by Joe Wells

  • Breaking Free from OCD: A CBT Guide for Young People and their Families by Jo Derisley, Isobel Heyman, Sarah Robinson, Cynthia Turner

  • The Unlikely Hero of Room 13B by Teresa Toten

Self-harm

  • The Truth About Self-Harm by Celia Richardson

Stress

  • Fighting Invisible Tigers: A Stress Management Guide for Teens by Earl Hipp

  • Teenage Guide to Stress by Nicola Morgan
